SAFETY CARD
Boeing 737~200/300
AIRLINES
The Spirit of the West
Please obey the "No Smoking" and "Fasten Seatbelt" signs,
all posted signs and placards and all instructions given by your flight crew.
FOR THE SAFETY OF OTHERS, PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE
THIS CARD FROM THE AIRCRAFT.

Exit Seating Criteria
If you are seated in an emergency exit seat, please review the following.
Federal Aviation Regulations require that passengers seated in these
seats meet the selection criteria and are willing and able to operate the
exit and assist others in the event of an emergency in which a
crewmember is not available to do so.
Please identify the exit nearest to you and review the corresponding
functions found on this Safety Card.
Please contact your Flight Attendant for reseating if you have a condition,
which is not apparent, that would prevent you from performing the
functions shown on this Safety Card; would be harmed from doing so;
do not wish to do so; or if any of the following apply:
• Mobility, strength or dexterity in both arms and legs is not sufficient to
perform the functions and assist others, including:
• Reaching the exit quickly. Reaching in every direction for mechanisms
used. Operating the exit. Securing the exit open. Removing obstructions
(maintaining balance while doing so). Quickly pass through the exit.
• You are less than 15 years old, require assistance from someone else
to perform one or more of these functions, or would be prevented from
doing so because of a condition or responsibility, such as caring for a
small child.
• You cannot sufficiently impart information orally to others or understand
crew commands.
• You cannot read or understand the written or graphic instructions
provided or require assistance (other than a hearing aid) to hear or
understand the instructions shouted by a crewmember.
• You do not have the visual capacity to assess conditions outside of the
exit or perform any function described without the assistance of visual
aids other than contact lenses or eyeglasses.
In the event of an emergency, follow the directions and hand signals of
your crew. If a crewmember is not available to assist you, follow the
instructions on the Safety Card and posted signs. Wait until the airplane
has stopped before opening the exit and look through the window,
assessing conditions (looking for smoke, fire or obstructions) to
determine whether it is safe to proceed. If it is safe to do so, operate the
exit and assist others according to the instructions. Assess, select and
follow a safe path away from the airplane.
Your Flight Attendants will be glad to answer any questions you might have.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by Frontier Airlines for its Boeing 737-200/300 fleet; white double-sided multi-fold card with illustrations and text demonstrating safety instructions and emergency procedures; information code TS 0114, dated 1999.
